page.title: 19FISH FARMING
page.content: Behind Maria Sqare in Belmont there are{ponds}where fish are farmed.The owners feed the{fish on natural food and B.P. trout pellets.They keep golden orfe, koi carp, tench and rudd.There are four ponds and in one of them is the largest fish of all, called the ghost koi, which shivers along the bottom of the pond.It weighs about six pounds. The owners have about 2,000 fish but hope to have 50,000 when they{breed. The fish are sold from 70p to Â£40. {Trade}is good with at least 1,000 customers a year coming to buy fish.This fish farm is one of four in the United Kingdom that breeds golden orfe.They start to sell the fish in spring and finish at the end of April.The fish spawn in June and July.
